intro: Kanimia purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-veined kanimia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking purple veins on its broad, ovate leaves. It produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. Kanimia purpurascens is often found in moist, shaded areas within dense forests.
